column4: trying to run a command, afterwards the output says Permission denied, " sudo name.of.command
what is name.of.command
path: /usr/lib/evolution/2.24
ls -la evolution-addressbook-export
-rwxr-xr-x 1 root root 23432 2009-01-14 06:15 evolution-addressbook-export
so what is the exact command you are using, exactly, word for word
sudo evolution-addressbook-export --format=csv > contacts.csv
ok /usr/lib/evolution isn't in your path (or the root sudo path) use the full path as the command
also you shouldn't be doing that as root, as root won't have an address book, your local user will
sudo /usr/lib/evolution/evolution-addressbook-export --format=csv > contacts.csv <- correct?
no - you shouldn't need to use sudo, as "root" won't have an addres book
sorry but didn't quite get the meaning "you shouldn't need to use sudo, as "root" won't have an addres book"

when you use "sudo" you are running a command as the root user, the user "root" won't have an evolution address book, so there will be nothing to do, as you can see that command has execute for every one permissions, so if you run it as yourself, it will work, and it will also export your address book
ok
does that make sense ?
the explanation was clear, the new question is how does one export contacts from evolution into a .csv? every instruction online states it's located in the /usr/lib/evolution path
what's teh problem with the command you're trying without sudo ?
(evolution-addressbook-export:9964): evolution-addressbook-tools-WARNING **: Couldn't load addressbook NULL
do you have an addressbook defined ?
(evolution-addressbook-export:9964): evolution-addressbook-tools-WARNING **: Couldn't load addressbook NULL
it's looking like you have an empty addressbook
it has contacts in it
check the syntax, do you have to speifcy where your address book is ?
